Vocabulary.question: What is the best English equivalent for the Chinese idiom '画蛇添足 (huà shé tiān zú)'?
options: To add legs to a snake (unnecessary actions)
To catch two birds with one stone
Vocabulary.answer: To add legs to a snake (unnecessary actions)

Grammar.question: Which sentence correctly uses the 把 (bǎ) structure?
options: 我把书放在桌子上。(Wǒ bǎ shū fàng zài zhuōzi shàng.)
书把我放在桌子上。(Shū bǎ wǒ fàng zài zhuōzi shàng.)
我放在书把桌子上。(Wǒ fàng zài shū bǎ zhuōzi shàng.)
把书我放在桌子上。(Bǎ shū wǒ fàng zài zhuōzi shàng.)
Grammar.answer: 我把书放在桌子上。(Wǒ bǎ shū fàng zài zhuōzi shàng.)

Grammar.question: Which of the following sentences is **incorrect**?
options: 我明天去学校。(Wǒ míngtiān qù xuéxiào.)
他昨天看书了。(Tā zuótiān kàn shū le.)
她吃饭不喜欢。(Tā chī fàn bù xǐhuān.)
我们一起去看电影。(Wǒmen yīqǐ qù kàn diànyǐng.)
Grammar.answer: 她吃饭不喜欢。(Tā chī fàn bù xǐhuān.)
